3D Desnity Calculation (revels_3D)

3D force-density estimators and utilities for RevelsMD.

This module provides the Revels3D functionality based nested classes that operate on a trajectory-state object (TS) to build 3D force grids, convert them to real-space densities via Fourier-space relations, write densities to .cube files, and compute optimal linear combinations (λ-method) of counting and force-based densities.

Notes

  • The code assumes an orthorhombic (or cubic) periodic box.

  • All kernels and gridding logic preserve your existing numerical behavior.

Overview

3D force-density estimators and utilities for RevelsMD.

This module provides the Revels3D class, which builds three-dimensional force and number density fields from MD trajectories using the reduced-variance force-sampling framework.

Classes

Revels3D

class revelsMD.revels_3D.Revels3D

Bases: object

Namespace wrapper for grid building, estimators, selection state, and helpers.

The nested classes are: - GridState: holds voxelized force accumulators and builds densities. - Estimators: per-frame estimators to deposit forces/weights on the grid. - SelectionState: encapsulates atom selections, masses/charges, and center logic. - HelperFunctions: numerics for COMs, dipoles, per-frame processing, kernels.

class GridState(TS, density_type, temperature, nbins=100, nbinsx=False, nbinsy=False, nbinsz=False)

Bases: object

State for accumulating 3D force fields and converting to densities.

Parameters

TSobject

Trajectory-state object providing box_x, box_y, box_z, and units.

density_type{‘number’, ‘charge’, ‘polarisation’}

Type of density to be constructed (controls the estimator weighting).

temperaturefloat

System temperature (K) used for force→density conversion in k-space.

nbinsint, optional

Default number of voxels per box dimension (overridden by nbinsx/y/z).

nbinsx, nbinsy, nbinszint or bool, optional

Explicit voxel counts per dimension. If False, fall back to nbins.

Attributes

forceX, forceY, forceZnp.ndarray

Accumulators for voxelized force components (shape: nbinsx×nbinsy×nbinsz).

counternp.ndarray

Accumulator for counting-based density (same shape as force accumulators).

binsx, binsy, binsznp.ndarray

Bin edges per dimension (inclusive right edge by construction here).

lx, ly, lzfloat

Voxel sizes in x/y/z.

voxel_volumefloat

Volume of a single voxel.

countint

Number of processed frames (for normalization).

grid_progress{‘Generated’, ‘Allocated’, ‘Lambda’}

Simple state flag used by getters and λ estimator.

make_force_grid(TS, atom_names, rigid=False, centre_location=True, kernel='triangular', polarisation_axis=0, start=0, stop=-1, period=1)

Accumulate per-frame force contributions on the voxel grid.

Parameters
TSobject

Trajectory-state object with positions/forces depending on TS.variety.

atom_namesstr or list of str

Atom name(s) used for selection (single species or multi-species molecule).

rigidbool, optional

Treat listed species as a rigid group and sum forces (default: False).

centre_locationbool or int, optional

If True, use center-of-mass; if int, use that atom index within the rigid set as the reference position (default: True).

kernel{‘triangular’,’box’}, optional

Deposition kernel for grid assignment (default: ‘triangular’).

polarisation_axisint, optional

Axis index for polarisation projection if density_type=’polarisation’.

startint, optional

Start frame index (default: 0).

stopint, optional

Stop frame index (default: -1; modulo behavior preserved).

periodint, optional

Frame stride (default: 1).

Raises
ValueError

On invalid frame selection, unsupported density/kernel combinations, or malformed inputs for rigid/centre options.

Parameters:

  • TS (Any)

  • atom_names (str | List[str])

  • rigid (bool)

  • centre_location (bool | int)

  • kernel (str)

  • polarisation_axis (int)

  • start (int)

  • stop (int)

  • period (int)

Return type:

None

get_real_density()

Convert accumulated force field to real-space density via FFT.

Notes

Implements (Borgis et al., Mol. Phys. 111, 3486–3492 (2013)): Δρ(k) = i / (k_B T k^2) * k · F(k), with Δρ(k=0) := 0, then ρ(r) = ⟨ρ_count(r)⟩ + ℱ⁻¹[Δρ(k)].

Side Effects

Sets self.del_rho_k, self.del_rho_n, self.particle_density, self.rho.

Return type:

None

get_particle_density()

Compute conventional counting-based density from self.counter.

Side Effects

Sets self.particle_density.

Return type:

None

get_kvectors()

Return the k-vectors (2π * FFT frequencies) per dimension.

Returns
(kx, ky, kz)tuple of np.ndarray

Frequency vectors for x, y, z (units: 1/length).

Return type:

Tuple[ndarray, ndarray, ndarray]

get_ksquared()

Return k^2 on the 3D grid (broadcasted from 1D k-vectors).

Returns
np.ndarray

k^2 array with shape (nbinsx, nbinsy, nbinsz).

Return type:

ndarray

write_to_cube(structure, grid, filename, convert_pmg=True)

Write a 3D density grid to a Gaussian .cube file.

Parameters
structurepymatgen.Structure or ase.Atoms

Input structure used to define the cell geometry. If convert_pmg=True, this is interpreted as a pymatgen Structure and converted to ASE Atoms. If convert_pmg=False, it is assumed to be an ASE Atoms already.

gridnp.ndarray

3D grid data to write (shape: nbinsx×nbinsy×nbinsz).

filenamestr

Output filename.

convert_pmgbool, optional

If True, convert from pymatgen.Structure → ASE Atoms first, then delete any atoms specified by self.SS.indicies. If False, assume structure is already an ASE Atoms and write directly.

Notes

  • Atom deletion occurs after conversion from pymatgen to ASE, preserving your original intent.

Parameters:

  • structure (Structure | Any)

  • grid (ndarray)

  • filename (str)

  • convert_pmg (bool)

Return type:

None

get_lambda(TS, sections=None)

Compute optimal λ(r) to combine counting and force densities.

Implements the linear-combination approach of: J. Chem. Phys. 154, 191101 (2021).

Parameters
TSobject

Trajectory-state providing per-frame positions and forces.

sectionsint, optional

Number of interleaved frame-subsets used to accumulate covariance buffers. If None, defaults to TS.frames.

Returns
Revels3D.GridState

A deep-copied GridState instance with expected_rho, expected_particle_density, delta, covariance/variance buffers, combination (=1−cov_F/var), and optimal_density populated.

Raises
RuntimeError

If called before make_force_grid.

ValueError

If called on a grid already produced by get_lambda.

Parameters:

  • TS (Any)

  • sections (int | None)

Return type:

GridState

Parameters:

  • TS (Any)

  • density_type (str)

  • temperature (float)

  • nbins (int)

  • nbinsx (int | bool)

  • nbinsy (int | bool)

  • nbinsz (int | bool)

class Estimators

Bases: object

Per-frame estimators that compute positions/weights and deposit to the grid.

Notes

All estimators call HelperFunctions.process_frame(…) which: - Applies periodic imaging to positions - Assigns per-atom contributions using a chosen kernel - Updates force accumulators (X/Y/Z) and the counting counter field

static single_frame_rigid_number_com_grid(positions, forces, TS, GS, SS, kernel='triangular')

Rigid molecule: number density at COM position; forces summed over rigid members.

static single_frame_rigid_number_atom_grid(positions, forces, TS, GS, SS, kernel='triangular')

Rigid molecule: number density at a specific atom’s position; forces summed over rigid members.

static single_frame_number_many_grid(positions, forces, TS, GS, SS, kernel='triangular')

Non-rigid: number density for each species list; deposit per-entry.

static single_frame_number_single_grid(positions, forces, TS, GS, SS, kernel='triangular')

Single species: number density at that species’ positions.

static single_frame_rigid_charge_atom_grid(positions, forces, TS, GS, SS, kernel='triangular')

Rigid molecule: charge-weighted density at a specific atom’s position.

static single_frame_charge_many_grid(positions, forces, TS, GS, SS, kernel='triangular')

Non-rigid: charge-weighted density for each entry.

static single_frame_charge_single_grid(positions, forces, TS, GS, SS, kernel='triangular')

Single species: charge-weighted density.

static single_frame_rigid_charge_com_grids(positions, forces, TS, GS, SS, kernel='triangular')

Rigid molecule: charge-weighted density at COM.

static single_frame_rigid_polarisation_com_grid(positions, forces, TS, GS, SS, kernel='triangular')

Rigid molecule: polarisation density projected along SS.polarisation_axis at COM.

static single_frame_rigid_polarisation_atom_grid(positions, forces, TS, GS, SS, kernel='triangular')

Rigid molecule: polarisation density projected along SS.polarisation_axis at COM (per original code).

class SelectionState(TS, atom_names, centre_location)

Bases: object

Atom selection, charges/masses, and center choice for grid deposition.

Parameters

TSobject

Trajectory-state with index/charge/mass accessors and charge_and_mass flag.

atom_namesstr or list of str

For a single species, may be a string or single-element list. For a rigid molecule, provide a list of species names in the rigid group.

centre_locationbool or int

If a rigid group is provided: True selects COM; int selects one species’ index within the rigid set as the center.

Attributes

indistinguishable_setbool

True if a single species is selected; False for multi-species (rigid).

indiciesnp.ndarray or list of np.ndarray

Atom indices of the selection (kept name for compatibility).

charges, masseslist or np.ndarray

Per-species arrays (rigid) or single array (single species) if available.

polarisation_axisint

Axis for polarisation projection (set by GridState when needed).

position_centre(species_number)

Set the active species index within a rigid group as the position center.

Parameters
species_numberint

Index into the multi-species selection list.

Raises
ValueError

If species_number is out of range for the current selection.

Parameters:

species_number (int)

Return type:

None

Parameters:

  • TS (Any)

  • atom_names (str | List[str])

  • centre_location (bool | int)

class HelperFunctions

Bases: object

Helper numerics for per-frame deposition, COMs, dipoles, and rigid sums.

static process_frame(TS, GS, positions, forces, a=1.0, kernel='triangular')

Deposit a frame’s positions/forces to the grid using a given kernel.

Parameters

TSobject

Trajectory state (box lengths used here).

GSGridState

Grid accumulators and bin geometry.

positions(N, 3) np.ndarray

Positions in Cartesian coordinates.

forces(N, 3) np.ndarray

Forces corresponding to positions.

afloat or np.ndarray, optional

Scalar or per-particle weight (number/charge/polarisation projection).

kernel{‘triangular’,’box’}, optional

Assignment kernel.

Notes

  • Positions are reduced into a primary image by component-wise remainders.

  • np.digitize is used to map positions to voxel indices; subsequent kernels deposit weighted contributions to neighbors (triangular) or the host voxel (box).

Parameters:

  • TS (Any)

  • GS (Any)

  • positions (ndarray)

  • forces (ndarray)

  • a (float)

  • kernel (str)

Return type:

None

static box_allocation(GS, x, y, z, fox, foy, foz, a)

Deposit contributions to the host voxel (no neighbor spreading).

Notes

This “rapid gridding” path assumes at most one particle per voxel for meaningful grids. This is the original behavior and is not enforced here.

Parameters:

  • GS (Any)

  • x (ndarray)

  • y (ndarray)

  • z (ndarray)

  • fox (ndarray)

  • foy (ndarray)

  • foz (ndarray)

  • a (float | ndarray)

Return type:

None

static triangular_allocation(GS, x, y, z, homeX, homeY, homeZ, fox, foy, foz, a)

Deposit contributions to the 8 neighboring voxel vertices (CIC/triangular).

Notes

We compute the fractional position of each atom within its voxel and distribute weights among the 8 vertices (x±1, y±1, z±1) using trilinear factors f_xyz. Periodicity is handled by modular wrapping of indices.

Parameters:

  • GS (Any)

  • x (ndarray)

  • y (ndarray)

  • z (ndarray)

  • homeX (ndarray)

  • homeY (ndarray)

  • homeZ (ndarray)

  • fox (ndarray)

  • foy (ndarray)

  • foz (ndarray)

  • a (float | ndarray)

Return type:

None

static rigid_check(SS)

Check that all rigid-body species have equal multiplicity.

Returns

bool

True if all lengths match; False otherwise.

Notes

Original behavior is preserved (early return inside loop).

Parameters:

SS (Any)

Return type:

bool

static find_coms(positons, TS, GS, SS, calc_dipoles=False)

Compute centers-of-mass (and optionally molecular dipoles) for a rigid set.

Parameters

positons(N, 3) np.ndarray

Cartesian coordinates (typo in name preserved for compatibility).

TSobject

Trajectory state containing box lengths.

GSGridState

Unused numerically here; preserved for signature compatibility.

SSSelectionState

Provides indicies, masses, and charges (if available).

calc_dipolesbool, optional

If True, also compute per-molecule dipole moments relative to COMs.

Returns

coms(M, 3) np.ndarray

Center-of-mass coordinates for M molecules.

molecular_dipole(M, 3) np.ndarray, optional

Returned if calc_dipoles=True.

Notes

Enforces minimum-image displacements when aligning species to a reference for COM and dipole accumulation.

Parameters:

  • positons (ndarray)

  • TS (Any)

  • GS (Any)

  • SS (Any)

  • calc_dipoles (bool)

static sum_forces(SS, forces)

Sum forces across a rigid group (species lists).

Parameters

SSSelectionState

Selection containing per-species atom index arrays.

forces(N, 3) np.ndarray

Force array for all atoms.

Returns

(M, 3) np.ndarray

Per-molecule net force for the rigid group (M = multiplicity).

Parameters:

  • SS (Any)

  • forces (ndarray)

Return type:

ndarray

Compute optimal λ(r) to combine counting and force densities.

Implements the linear-combination approach of: J. Chem. Phys. 154, 191101 (2021).

If called before make_force_grid.

Convert accumulated force field to real-space density via FFT.

Notes

Implements (Borgis et al., Mol. Phys. 111, 3486–3492 (2013)): Δρ(k) = i / (k_B T k^2) * k · F(k), with Δρ(k=0) := 0, then ρ(r) = ⟨ρ_count(r)⟩ + ℱ⁻¹[Δρ(k)].

make_force_grid(TS, atom_names, rigid=False, centre_location=True, kernel='triangular', polarisation_axis=0, start=0, stop=-1, period=1)

Accumulate per-frame force contributions on the voxel grid.

Parameters
TSobject

Trajectory-state object with positions/forces depending on TS.variety.

atom_namesstr or list of str

Atom name(s) used for selection (single species or multi-species molecule).

rigidbool, optional

Treat listed species as a rigid group and sum forces (default: False).

centre_locationbool or int, optional

If True, use center-of-mass; if int, use that atom index within the rigid set as the reference position (default: True).

kernel{‘triangular’,’box’}, optional

Deposition kernel for grid assignment (default: ‘triangular’).

polarisation_axisint, optional

Axis index for polarisation projection if density_type=’polarisation’.

startint, optional

Start frame index (default: 0).

stopint, optional

Stop frame index (default: -1; modulo behavior preserved).

periodint, optional

Frame stride (default: 1).

Raises
ValueError

On invalid frame selection, unsupported density/kernel combinations, or malformed inputs for rigid/centre options.

Parameters:

  • TS (Any)

  • atom_names (str | List[str])

  • rigid (bool)

  • centre_location (bool | int)

  • kernel (str)

  • polarisation_axis (int)

  • start (int)

  • stop (int)

  • period (int)

Return type:

write_to_cube(structure, grid, filename, convert_pmg=True)

Write a 3D density grid to a Gaussian .cube file.

Parameters
structurepymatgen.Structure or ase.Atoms

Input structure used to define the cell geometry. If convert_pmg=True, this is interpreted as a pymatgen Structure and converted to ASE Atoms. If convert_pmg=False, it is assumed to be an ASE Atoms already.

gridnp.ndarray

3D grid data to write (shape: nbinsx×nbinsy×nbinsz).

filenamestr

Output filename.

convert_pmgbool, optional

If True, convert from pymatgen.Structure → ASE Atoms first, then delete any atoms specified by self.SS.indicies. If False, assume structure is already an ASE Atoms and write directly.

Notes

  • Atom deletion occurs after conversion from pymatgen to ASE, preserving your original intent.

Parameters:

  • structure (Structure | Any)

  • grid (ndarray)

  • filename (str)

  • convert_pmg (bool)

Return type:

None

  • density_type (str)

static process_frame(TS, GS, positions, forces, a=1.0, kernel='triangular')

Deposit a frame’s positions/forces to the grid using a given kernel.

Parameters

TSobject

Trajectory state (box lengths used here).

GSGridState

Grid accumulators and bin geometry.

positions(N, 3) np.ndarray

Positions in Cartesian coordinates.

forces(N, 3) np.ndarray

Forces corresponding to positions.

afloat or np.ndarray, optional

Scalar or per-particle weight (number/charge/polarisation projection).

kernel{‘triangular’,’box’}, optional

Assignment kernel.

Notes

  • Positions are reduced into a primary image by component-wise remainders.

  • np.digitize is used to map positions to voxel indices; subsequent kernels deposit weighted contributions to neighbors (triangular) or the host voxel (box).

Parameters:

  • TS (Any)

  • GS (Any)

  • positions (ndarray)

  • forces (ndarray)

  • a (float)

  • kernel (str)

Return type:

None

static rigid_check(SS)

Check that all rigid-body species have equal multiplicity.

Returns

bool

True if all lengths match; False otherwise.

Notes

Original behavior is preserved (early return inside loop).

Parameters:

SS (Any)

Return type:

bool

static sum_forces(SS, forces)

Sum forces across a rigid group (species lists).

Parameters

SSSelectionState

Selection containing per-species atom index arrays.

forces(N, 3) np.ndarray

Force array for all atoms.

Returns

(M, 3) np.ndarray

Per-molecule net force for the rigid group (M = multiplicity).

Parameters:

  • SS (Any)

  • forces (ndarray)

Return type:

ndarray

static triangular_allocation(GS, x, y, z, homeX, homeY, homeZ, fox, foy, foz, a)

Deposit contributions to the 8 neighboring voxel vertices (CIC/triangular).

Notes

We compute the fractional position of each atom within its voxel and distribute weights among the 8 vertices (x±1, y±1, z±1) using trilinear factors f_xyz. Periodicity is handled by modular wrapping of indices.

Parameters:

  • GS (Any)

  • x (ndarray)

  • y (ndarray)

  • z (ndarray)

  • homeX (ndarray)

  • homeY (ndarray)

  • homeZ (ndarray)

  • fox (ndarray)

  • foy (ndarray)

  • foz (ndarray)

  • a (float | ndarray)

Return type:

None
